infos.value: Wh-wh-what do you intend to do?
Spare me, I beg you. I ask for nothing more.
...What shall we do, Lord Mont?
Tzztztzt...
Lord Mont!?
There's a sound coming from this strange device.
Wait, let me see that for a moment.
King Muragaaa! It's me! It's Oldoa!
Help meee!
Wh-why, you! What are you doing!?
Shh! You stay quiet.
Oldoa... Has th' fortress fallen into enemy hands?
If so, take it back.
Everyone. Stop what yer doing and depart for th' fortress!
H-how is this possible? I can hear Muraga's voice coming from this device...
The strength of the Fennes army lies in this communication device. Do you understand me?
So Muraga can command his soldiers directly, no matter the distance...
...How about it? You kindly spare my life, and I offer my full cooperation in return. What say you?
...It's your call, Lord Mont.
What do you mean by "cooperation"?
This device is not just for King Muraga to command his underlings.
His Fierceness can hear our voices—and our reports—as well.
...What kind of reports?
Leave this to me. But you will stay quiet, yes?
King Muraga... Can Your Fierceness hear me?
...Oldoa? Are yer unharmed?
On the contrary, I am to be held captive.
Worry not. I'll be there shortly.
What o' th' enemy?
Just Leonis troops here at the fortress.
Their guard is lowered—drunk off their victory, no doubt.
I see. Lucky us.
Th' dense forest east o' th' fortress makes fer rough traveling.
We'll use that expectation to our advantage an' stage an ambush.
Endure just a while longer. Wait for us.
...How was that? I fully cooperated, did I not?
I suppose you did.
And...?
A deal is a deal.
We shall spare you. However...
You won't be released until Muraga has been slain.
...Are we in agreement?
Yes. You will hear no objection from me.
If that is our plan, then we must ready ourselves posthaste.
Let's settle the score with that savage.
...Lilyth.
What is it, Lord Mont?
(Lower your voices, everyone.)
(I have a proposal for our final stand against Muraga.)
(If we know that our enemy is coming through the forest, we needn't wait here.)
(So...an ambush, then?)
(Right. It would give us an even greater advantage.)
(What do we do with Oldoa?)
(Detain her within the fortress, with three or so soldiers keeping watch.)
(I like it. Let's go with that.)
Heh heh. I've got a good feeling about this!
Baelo, I'm entrusting you with her communication device. Don't lose it, all right?
Roger!
A surprise attack, huh...
But...
Why was it so hushed before? They should speak up so everyone can hear the plan...
